body_html:
At some point I suggested adding a legacy option to the print_options. That could accommodate old users that are not necessarily happy with the now print.
Adding the shape argument is a possibility (and is already present when in some cases in numpy), but maybe we only add the print in str and not in repr?
body_text:
At some point I suggested adding a legacy option to the print_options. That could accommodate old users that are not necessarily happy with the now print.
Adding the shape argument is a possibility (and is already present when in some cases in numpy), but maybe we only add the print in str and not in repr?
body:
At some point I suggested adding a `legacy` option to the print_options. That could accommodate old users that are not necessarily happy with the now print.
Adding the shape argument is a possibility (and is already present when in some cases in numpy), but maybe we only add the print in `str` and not in `repr`?
